title: Vincent L. Ott
text:
If you want to draw meaningful conclusions from data,
you should visualize it as it might otherwise mislead you.
For many scenarios in empirical sciences,
so called raincloud plots are incredibly useful for this.
In this blog post I explain how raincloud plots work and
how you can easily use them to visualize your own data.
For example, to see how penguins¬¥ body mass and flipper length are distributed: üêß
